title: Victorian Skills Plan Implementation Update

relatedLinks.text: State of the Victorian Labour Market Report

meta.description: The Victorian Skills Plan outlines how we are tracking against the 25 initiatives identified in last year's skills plan.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Victorian Skills Plan Implementation Update | Victorian Government

summary: The Victorian Skills Plan outlines how we are tracking against the 25 initiatives identified in last year's skills plan.

chapters.title: The Victorian Skills Plan 2022 into 2023 actions and initiatives
chapters.summary: The 25 initiatives scheduled to start in year one are well underway.

chapters.title: Promoting post-secondary education skills and career pathways
chapters.summary: The first priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

chapters.title: Lifting participation in education and training
chapters.summary: The second priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

chapters.title: Delivering the right skills for the jobs of today and tomorrow
chapters.summary: The third priority area's actions and initiatives from the Victorian Skills Plan 2022.

chapters.title: The Victorian Skills Plan supports action on skills
chapters.summary: Learn what's been achieved since the Victorian Skills Plan for 2022 into 2023 was implemented.

chapters.title: Start the VET journey at school
chapters.summary: Improvements including a strengthened VET Delivered To School Students system have increased access to VET options for schools.

chapters.title: Enable learners and workers to make informed skills and career choices
chapters.summary: Using intelligence gathered through various resources, the Victorian Skills Authority has helped learners understand their options and advised employers on upskilling.

chapters.title: Expand opportunities and approaches for students to put theory into practice during their course
chapters.summary: Practical placement officers have been funded for all Victorian TAFE Network providers to assist students seeking placements.

chapters.title: Build foundation skills to enhance workforce participation
chapters.summary: Accredited and pre-accredited foundation skills support skill development across a range of areas to enable individuals to participate in education and training, work and life.

chapters.title: Bridge the gender gap
chapters.summary: Attracting more women into the labour force and increasing the number of female workers, is critical.

chapters.title: Build skills to support Victoria's clean economy intentions
chapters.summary: There are many initiatives in place to support the Clean Economy Workforce Development Strategy.

chapters.title: Create innovative solutions to support future skills development
chapters.summary: How the skills system is keeping up with changing occupations and shifts in industries and jobs.

chapters.title: Align qualifications to new needs
chapters.summary: Using existing skills classification tools, the Victorian Skills Authority is exploring approaches to better describe changing skills demand in the Victorian economy.

chapters.title: Drive for higher skills and progression through education and training
chapters.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority is progressing reforms in the skills and training system.

chapters.title: Build the VET workforce
chapters.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority has commenced work on the VET Workforce Development Strategy through a range of initiatives.

chapters.title: Expand re-skilling and up-skilling opportunities through skill sets
chapters.summary: The Victorian Skills Authority's Industry Advisory Groups and Skills and Jobs Centres have played an important part in supporting learners up-skill through skills sets.

documents.name: Victorian Skills Plan Implementation Update October 2023
